identificationModule.briefTitle: Long Term Study Of Amlodipine 10mg With Hypertension For Whom Amlodipine 5mg Is Insufficient
identificationModule.officialTitle: Long-Term Study For Amlodipine 10mg In Patients With Essential Hypertension For Whom Amlodipine 5mg Is Insufficiently Effective

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To investigate the safety and efficacy of the long-term use of amlodipine 10 mg in subjects who will be able to enter a long-term study after completing the parent study "A double-blind comparative study between amlodipine 5 mg and 10 mg in patients with essential hypertension for whom amlodipine 5 mg is insufficiently effective" (Protocol No.: A0531085).

interventions.name: Amlodipine
interventions.description: Two tablets of amlodipine 5 mg, Oral administration, Once daily for 44 weeks

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure From Baseline of the Preceding Study
primaryOutcomes.description: Value at each observation time point minus value at Week 0 (Week 0 was defined as baseline of the preceding study A0531085: NCT00415623.)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Week 0, 8 weeks, 10 weeks, 12 weeks, 16 weeks, 20 weeks, 24 weeks, 28 weeks, 32 weeks, 36 weeks, 40 weeks, 44 weeks, 48 weeks and 52 weeks

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure From Baseline of This Long-term Study
primaryOutcomes.description: Value at each observation time point minus value at Week 8 (Week 8 was defined as baseline of this long-term study A0531086: NCT00443456.)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Week 8, 10 weeks, 12 weeks, 16 weeks, 20 weeks, 24 weeks, 28 weeks, 32 weeks, 36 weeks, 40 weeks, 44 weeks, 48 weeks and 52 weeks

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure From Baseline of the Preceding Study
primaryOutcomes.description: Value at each observation time point minus value at Week 0 (Week 0 was defined as baseline of the preceding study A0531085: NCT00415623.)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Week 0, 8 weeks, 10 weeks, 12 weeks, 16 weeks, 20 weeks, 24 weeks, 28 weeks, 32 weeks, 36 weeks, 40 weeks, 44 weeks, 48 weeks and 52 weeks

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure From Baseline of This Long-term Study
primaryOutcomes.description: Value at each observation time point minus value at Week 8 (Week 8 was defined as baseline of this long-term study A0531086: NCT00443456.)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Week 8, 10 weeks, 12 weeks, 16 weeks, 20 weeks, 24 weeks, 28 weeks, 32 weeks, 36 weeks, 40 weeks, 44 weeks, 48 weeks and 52 weeks

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Subjects Whose Blood Pressure Reached Target Blood Pressure Reduction Value
primaryOutcomes.description: Target blood pressure reduction value in accordance with Japanese Society of Hypertension Guidelines for the Management of Hypertension 2004: For \<= 64 years old: systolic blood pressure below 130 mmHg and diastolic blood pressure below 85 mmHg; For \>= 65 years old: systolic blood pressure below 140 mmHg and diastolic blood pressure below 90 mmHg
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 8 weeks, 10 weeks, 12 weeks, 16 weeks, 20 weeks, 24 weeks, 28 weeks, 32 weeks, 36 weeks, 40 weeks, 44 weeks, 48 weeks and 52 weeks

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Subjects Whose Blood Pressure Reached Target Blood Pressure Reduction Value and Systolic Blood Pressure Had Decreased by 10 mmHg or More From Baseline in the Preceding Study
primaryOutcomes.description: Target blood pressure reduction value in accordance with Japanese Society of Hypertension Guidelines for the Management of Hypertension 2004: For \<= 64 years old: systolic blood pressure below 130 mmHg and diastolic blood pressure below 85 mmHg; For \>= 65 years old: systolic blood pressure below 140 mmHg and diastolic blood pressure below 90 mmHg
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 8 weeks, 10 weeks, 12 weeks, 16 weeks, 20 weeks, 24 weeks, 28 weeks, 32 weeks, 36 weeks, 40 weeks, 44 weeks, 48 weeks and 52 weeks

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients who had completed the preceding study A0531085, Phase III study, who the investigator judged to be able to further treatment of long term administration in terms of efficacy and safety
* Patients who had a treatment compliance rate of at least 80%

Exclusion Criteria:

* The patient who met the discontinuation criteria in the preceding study A0531085

seeAlsoLinks.label: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: Among subjects who had completed the preceding study (A0531085, NCT00415623), where either Amlodipine 5 mg or 10 mg was administered for 8 weeks, those who were considered to be eligible for enrollment in this long-term study, based on safety and efficacy of the preceding study and who had a treatment compliance rate of at least 80% were enrolled.

certainAgreement.otherDetails: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of \< 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), \< 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.
